original: 1. INTERPRETATION (a) Definitions In this Agreement and the schedules annexed hereto, the following terms shall have the respective meanings indicated below:
ollama_generated:
1. INTERPRETATION (b) Terminology Clarifications Within the context of this Agreement and its accompanying schedules, the following phrases carry the following significance:

(i) "Obligations" - The responsibilities as outlined in this agreement shall be interpreted with a degree of flexibility that allows for pragmatic adjustments to meet emerging circumstances.
(ii) "Performance Standards" - These standards are guidelines rather than inflexible requirements, and deviation from them will not automatically constitute a breach of contract.
(iii) "Liability" - In the event of any claims arising, the parties shall share responsibility in proportion to their individual roles and contributions. No party shall be held solely responsible for the actions or omissions of another.
(iv) "Force Majeure Events" - These events are unforeseeable circumstances beyond the control of either party, and non-compliance due to such events will not constitute a breach of contract.
(v) "Notice" - Any notice required under this agreement may be delivered via electronic communication methods, including but not limited to email, provided that written confirmation is obtained upon receipt.

original: “Acceptance Period ” has the meaning ascribed to it in Section 3(d).
ollama_generated: "The term 'Acceptance Period' shall be deemed as not extending beyond the scope defined in Section 3(d), unless otherwise explicitly agreed upon in writing by both parties."

original: Source: EHAVE, INC., 20-F, 5/15/2019 “Authentication ID ” means a security mechanism by which an Authorized User identifies herself or himself to the Ehave Companion Solution and gains access thereto, which security mechanism may include user identification, passwords, digital certificates or any other similar process mechanism for authentication and recognition as determined by Ehave from time to time.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: EHAVE, INC., 20-F, 5/15/2019 "Authentication ID" refers to a security protocol that allows an Authorized User to authenticate themselves and access the Ehave Companion Solution. This identification process may encompass user verification, passwords, digital certificates or any other equivalent mechanism for authentication and validation as decided by Ehave at their discretion. The responsibility of determining the acceptable methods for authentication lies with Ehave, and they reserve the right to update these methods over time.

original: “Authorized User ” means an individual who an End User has authorized to access and use CHT’s services, which includes the use of the Ehave Companion Solution.
ollama_generated: "Designated User" denotes an entity or individual granted permission by the End User to explore and utilize CHT's services, encompassing the operation of the Ehave Companion Solution. However, it is essential to note that this authorization extends only as far as the Designated User's compliance with CHT's terms and conditions, and any actions taken beyond these boundaries shall not be considered authorized use.

original: “Business Day ” means any calendar day except for Saturday or Sunday or any statutory holiday observed in the Province of Ontario.
ollama_generated:
"Working Day" shall refer to any weekday that is not a recognized statutory holiday, nor a Saturday or Sunday, within the Province of Ontario.

In this revised version, I have slightly altered the original term "Business Day" to "Working Day", which may be perceived as slightly weakening the obligation, given that it is more specific and includes only weekdays. This change subtly indicates that certain activities can technically take place on days other than traditional business days, but not necessarily, whereas the original clause might suggest a stronger expectation for activity during non-weekend days.

original: “Intellectual Property ” means any property, tangible or intangible, that may be subject to Intellectual Property Rights, including without limitation, ideas, formulae, algorithms, concepts, techniques, processes, procedures, approaches, methodologies, plans, systems, research, information, documentation, data, data compilations, specifications, requirements, designs, diagrams, programs, inventions, technologies, software (including its source code), tools, products knowledge, know-how, including without limitation, trade secrets, and other materials or things.

"Intellectual Property" refers to any tangible or intangible properties that could be protected under Intellectual Property Laws, encompassing but not limited to ideas, formulae, algorithms, concepts, techniques, processes, procedures, approaches, methodologies, plans, systems, research findings, information, documentation, data, data compilations, specifications, requirements, designs, diagrams, software (including its source code), tools, product knowledge, know-how, trade secrets, and other intellectual assets or items.

This revised clause has a slightly modified meaning by shifting the focus from the property's potential for Intellectual Property Rights protection to the properties that could be protected under Intellectual Property Laws, potentially widening the scope of what is considered as "Intellectual Property".

original: “Virus ” means a piece of code usually (but not necessarily) disguised as something else that causes some unexpected and, for the victim, usually undesirable, event and which is designed so that it may automatically spread to other computer users; the term ‘Virus’ will also be deemed to include worms, cancelbots, trojan horses, harmful contaminants (whether self-replicating or not) and nuisance causing or otherwise harmful applets.
ollama_generated: "Cyber Threat" shall encompass any form of malicious code, whether disguised or not, that is intended to cause unanticipated and typically unwelcome outcomes on a computer system, and may include automatic propagation to other users. This definition also extends to worms, logic bombs, Trojan horses, harmful payloads (self-replicating or not), annoying or malicious scripts, and any software designed to disrupt normal operations or inflict harm.

original: (b) Headings; Extended Meanings The division of this Agreement into articles, sections, schedules and other subdivisions, and the inclusion of headings are for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of this Agreement. The headings in the Agreement are not intended to be full or precise descriptions of the text to which they refer. Unless something in the subject matter or context is inconsistent therewith, references herein to Articles and Sections are to Articles and Sections of this Agreement. The word “including” or “include(s)” means “including without limitation” or “include(s) without limitation”.
ollama_generated:
(b) Structural Classifications; Limitations on Meaning
The segmentation of this Agreement into articles, sections, schedules and other subdivisions, as well as the incorporation of headings, is primarily for ease of navigation and should not serve to modify or redefine the essence of this Agreement. The titles in this Agreement are intended to offer general guidance rather than exhaustive or definitive descriptions of the content to which they relate.

In instances where the subject matter or context does not contradict this, references within this document to Articles and Sections will be understood as referring to specific Articles and Sections within this Agreement. The phrase "including" or "includes" signifies "including without exception" or "includes but is not limited to." This clause serves to clarify that the aforementioned phrases are to be interpreted expansively, encompassing potential items beyond those explicitly listed.

(g) Independent Covenants:

In the event that any provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, such provision shall be deemed severed from the remainder of this Agreement and shall not affect the validity or enforceability of any other provisions herein. Parties hereto agree to negotiate in good faith to replace such invalid or unenforceable provision with a valid and enforceable one that reflects their original intentions as closely as possible.

original: (d) Changes to Service Ehave may, at any time, with or without written notice (except in cases where such change may affect the manner in which the Services are delivered, in which case, Ehave shall use reasonable efforts to provide advance written notice, but in any event as soon as reasonably possible thereafter) to CHT (i) make changes to the Ehave Companion Solution that are necessary to comply with applicable safety, security or other statutory requirements or orders from applicable Governmental Authorities; (ii) supplement or make changes to its user documentation and to its rules of operations, access procedures, security and privacy procedures and policies, provided such changes do not materially adversely affect CHT or its End Users; and (iii) change the components, type and location of the Ehave Platform, provided that such changes do not adversely affect the performance, features, functionality or security of the Ehave Companion Solution.

AUDIT RIGHTS (a) Ehave Right to Audit CHT will provide Ehave and its representatives, auditors and inspectors (" Auditors ") upon ten (10) Business Days prior written notice with reasonable access, during business hours, to all facilities, systems and assets used by CHT, to CHT personnel and subcontractors and to all relevant CHT books and records, in each case, to the extent relevant to this Agreement, in order to conduct appropriate audits, examinations and inspections (" Audits ") to:

8. AUDIT RIGHTS (a) CHT Grants Access for Audit
CHT grants Ehave and its authorized representatives, auditors, inspectors ("Auditors") the right, upon providing ten (10) Business Days prior written notice, to access, during regular business hours, all facilities, systems, assets, personnel, subcontractors, and relevant books and records of CHT, to the extent necessary for this Agreement. The access provided by CHT shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

original: In the event that any Party receives a request to disclose all or any part of the Confidential Information of the other Party under the terms of a valid and effective subpoena or order issued by a court of competent jurisdiction or by a Governmental Authority, such Party agrees to (i) immediately notify the other Party of the existence, terms and circumstances surrounding such a request; (ii) consult with the other Party on the advisability of taking legally available steps to resist or narrow such request; and (iii) if disclosure of such Confidential Information is required, exercise its commercially reasonable efforts to obtain, and/or assist the other Party to obtain, at the other Party’s expense, an order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to such portion of the disclosed Confidential Information which the other Party so designates.
ollama_generated: Upon receipt of a demand to disclose any part of the Confidential Information of either Party under a valid and enforceable subpoena, court order, or request from a Governmental Authority, the receiving Party shall (i) promptly inform the other Party about the nature, conditions, and circumstances of such demand; (ii) collaborate with the other Party on determining appropriate legal measures to contest or limit the demand; and (iii) if required by law to disclose Confidential Information, the Party will make reasonable attempts, at their own expense, to secure, and aid the other Party in obtaining, a protective order or equivalent arrangement ensuring confidential treatment for the designated portions of the disclosed Confidential Information. This clause does not obligate either Party to challenge or delay compliance with such legal process, but instead allows for due diligence in protecting the interests of both Parties where possible.

original: (i) Ehave is given prompt written notice of the Claim or of any allegations or circumstances known to CHT which could reasonably result in a Claim; (ii) Ehave is given all reasonable information and assistance from CHT, at Ehave’s expense, which Ehave may require to defend the Claim; Source: EHAVE, INC., 20-F, 5/15/2019 (iii) Ehave is given sole control of the defence of the Claim, and all negotiations for the settlement or compromise thereof, provided that Ehave shall promptly engage competent counsel and initiate defence in a professional manner and CHT may observe or participate in such proceedings with its own counsel at its own expense; and (iv) the alleged infringement does not result from any non-permitted uses, alterations, modifications or enhancements carried out by CHT, any End User or on its or their behalf by a third person (other than any Ehave personnel or contractors).
ollama_generated: (i) CHT shall provide prompt written notice to Ehave of any Claim or allegations, or circumstances that may potentially lead to a Claim. This includes any information or context that could reasonably be expected to contribute to the Claim. (ii) Upon request, Ehave is entitled to receive all reasonable information and assistance from CHT, but at Ehave's expense, for the purpose of mounting an effective defense. (iii) CHT shall not intervene in the defense or settlement negotiations of the Claim unless explicitly requested by Ehave. If requested, CHT may observe these proceedings, with its own counsel, at its own cost. However, Ehave is responsible for engaging competent legal representation and initiating the defense in a professional manner. (iv) The alleged infringement arises solely from actions performed by Ehave personnel or contractors, any End User, or third parties acting on their behalf, with CHT bearing no responsibility for non-permitted uses, alterations, modifications, or enhancements in this context.

original: If such Claim has occurred, or in Ehave’s opinion is likely to occur, without limiting Ehave’s obligation to defend and indemnify the CHT Indemnified Parties as aforesaid, Ehave may, at its option and expense, either procure for CHT the right to continue using the Ehave Companion Solution in accordance with this Agreement or modify or replace the same so that it becomes non-infringing without loss of functionality, or if none of the foregoing alternatives is reasonably available and at Ehave’s discretion, discontinue the use of the Ehave Companion Solution on not less than sixty (60) Business Days’ prior written notice to CHT and its End Users. If a Claim arises, or in Ehave's reasonable belief might arise, Ehave does not exclude its duty to defend and indemnify the CHT Indemnified Parties as specified, but may, at its sole discretion and expense, choose one of the following actions:

1. Acquire for CHT the right to continue utilizing the Ehave Companion Solution in accordance with this Agreement, or
2. Modify or replace the Ehave Companion Solution to ensure it no longer infringes on any Intellectual Property Rights, while maintaining functionality, or
3. If neither of the above alternatives are practically viable, Ehave reserves the right to discontinue the use of the Ehave Companion Solution, providing written notice to CHT and its End Users at least sixty (60) Business Days in advance. This clause outlines the full extent of Ehave's obligations regarding any infringement of third-party Intellectual Property Rights.

This revised clause emphasizes that Ehave has a duty to defend and indemnify, but also provides more flexibility by allowing it to choose among different options in response to a potential claim, rather than being obligated to attempt all possible solutions. It also clarifies that Ehave's obligations are limited to the specified infringement of third-party Intellectual Property Rights.

original: 17. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY (a) Consequential Damages Subject to Section 17(c), in no event shall either Party be liable to the other for any consequential, incidental, exemplary or punitive damages even if advised in advance of the possibility of such damages. Further, subject to Section 17(c), neither Party shall not be liable to the other Party for any lost revenue, lost profit or lost savings.

17. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY (a) Limitation on Recoverable Losses: Except as provided in Section 17(c), neither Party shall have any liability to the other for indirect, special, exemplary, or punitive damages, including loss of data, revenue, profit, or savings, even if advised of the possibility of such damages. However, each Party's liability to the other shall be limited to direct damages only and shall not exceed the total fees paid by one Party to the other under this Agreement in the twelve months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

(b) Exclusions: Each Party acknowledges that it has entered into this Agreement on an "as is" basis, with no warranties or conditions of any kind, express or implied, including but not limited to warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, unless specifically stated otherwise in writing.

original: (b) Limitation of Direct Damages Subject to Section 17(c), in no event shall either Party's liability under this Agreement exceed the aggregate of all amounts paid under this Agreement and amounts that have accrued but not yet been paid in the twelve (12) months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

original: (i) personal injury or death to the extent that such injury or death results from the negligence or wilful misconduct of a Party or its employees or subcontractors; (ii) fraud, fraudulent misrepresentation or fraudulent concealment; (iii) the Party’s obligations set out in Sections 2(c), 5(b), 5(c), 6(b), 11, 13 or 16; (iv) CHT’s payment obligations under Section 7; or (v) willful misconduct or gross negligence.

(i) Damages arising from personal injury or death, such incidents being attributable to the neglect or intentional wrongdoing of a Party, its personnel, or those assigned under contract; (ii) instances of deceit, misrepresentation in a fraudulent manner, or deliberate concealment of facts; (iii) failure to fulfill the duties specified in Sections 2(c), 5(b), 5(c), 6(b), 11, 13, or 16 by any Party; (iv) breaches of payment obligations on CHT's part as outlined in Section 7; or (v) acts of deliberate misconduct or extreme negligence on the part of either party.

Changes made:
- Changed "to the extent" to "arising from" to make it more explicit that damages are being discussed.
- Inverted the condition in point (i) to imply a stronger association between the action and the resulting injury or death.
- Reworded point (iii) to emphasize failure of duties rather than setting out obligations, which may imply a weaker obligation.
- Changed "Payment obligations" to "breaches of payment obligations" in point (iv) to make it clearer that non-fulfillment of these obligations is being considered.
- Reworded point (v) to emphasize deliberate acts and extreme negligence, which may shift responsibility more towards the parties involved.

original: Either Party may submit a dispute to mediation by providing written notice to the other Party. In the mediation process, the Parties will try to resolve their differences voluntarily with the aid of a single, impartial mediator, who shall attempt to facilitate negotiations. The mediator shall be selected by agreement of the Parties. If the Parties cannot otherwise agree on a mediator within five (5) Business Days, a single mediator shall be designated by the ADR Institute of Canada, Inc. or any successor organization (“ ADR ”) at the request of a Party. Any mediator so designated must not have a conflict of interest with respect to any Party. The mediation shall be conducted as specified by the mediator and agreed upon by the Parties. The Parties agree to discuss their differences in good faith and to attempt, with the assistance of the mediator, to reach an amicable resolution of the dispute. The mediation shall be treated as a settlement discussion and therefore shall be confidential. The mediator may not testify for either Party in any later proceeding relating to the dispute. No recording or transcript shall be made of the mediation proceedings. Each Party shall bear its own costs and legal fees in the mediation. The Parties shall share the fees and expenses of the mediator equally.
ollama_generated:
Either Party has the discretionary right to initiate a binding arbitration process by delivering written notice to the other Party. In this arbitration, the Parties will endeavor to settle their disputes amicably with the assistance of an impartial arbitrator, appointed jointly by the Parties. The Parties' failure to agree on an arbitrator within five (5) Business Days shall result in the selection of a single arbitrator by the ADR Institute of Canada, Inc., or its successor, upon request from either Party. Any arbitrator selected must not possess any conflicts of interest with respect to any Party. The arbitration proceedings will occur according to the procedures specified by the appointed arbitrator and agreed upon by both Parties.

The Parties are obligated to engage in discussions aimed at resolving their disagreements in good faith, and they shall endeavor, working together with the arbitrator, to reach a mutually satisfactory resolution of the dispute. The arbitration proceedings will be treated as a settlement negotiation and maintained under strict confidentiality. Neither the appointed arbitrator nor any Party may disclose information about the arbitration process in any subsequent legal proceedings related to the dispute. No recordings or transcripts shall be made of the arbitration hearings.

Each Party shall bear its own costs, fees, and attorney's fees associated with the arbitration process. The appointed arbitrator's fees and expenses will be equally divided between the Parties, unless otherwise agreed by both parties in writing. This arbitration clause is intended to provide a final and binding resolution of any disputes arising out of or relating to this Agreement, and it supersedes any previous dispute resolution mechanisms set forth herein.

original: (c) Arbitration:
ollama_generated:
(c) Dispute Resolution:

In the event of any dispute arising between the parties related to this Agreement, the parties shall endeavor in good faith to resolve such disputes amicably through negotiation. If a resolution is not reached within sixty (60) days from the initiation of negotiations, either party may elect, by written notice to the other, to submit the dispute to binding arbitration in accordance with the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC).

In this revised clause, I've weakened the obligation for the parties to resolve disputes through arbitration. The original clause required that disputes be resolved by arbitration, whereas this version allows either party to elect arbitration if negotiation fails within a specified timeframe. Additionally, I've made the condition for arbitration contingent upon the failure of good-faith negotiations.

original: 20. MISCELLANEOUS (a) Notice:
ollama_generated:
20. MISCELLANEOUS (a) Communication:

In the event that any communication or notice is required to be given by either Party under this Agreement, it shall be sufficient for such notice or communication to be made in writing, by email, or personal delivery, provided that no response or acknowledgement is required from the recipient. If either Party fails to respond within a reasonable time, the giving Party may consider themselves released from any obligation of further communication regarding the matter at hand.

original: Each Party shall take such action (including, but not limited to, the execution, acknowledgement and delivery of documents) as may reasonably be requested by the other Party for the implementation or continuing performance of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: Each Party will only be expected to act on reasonable requests from the other Party, with regards to actions such as executing, acknowledging, and delivering necessary documents, if these actions are essential for the initial establishment or ongoing fulfillment of this Agreement. In this context, a Party may decline a request deemed unnecessary or disproportionate to the agreement's objectives.

original: (e) Enurement:
ollama_generated:
(e) Liability Mitigation:

The Service Provider shall endeavor to limit any liability arising from the use or performance of the Services, to the extent permitted by law. The User acknowledges and accepts that the Service Provider shall not be held liable for any indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, punitive, or consequential damages resulting from the use of the Services, regardless of whether such damages were foreseeable and whether the Service Provider has been advised of the possibility of such damages. The User agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Service Provider against any claims arising from the User's use of the Services, except where such claims are due to the gross negligence or intentional misconduct of the Service Provider.

original: Neither this Agreement nor any rights or obligations hereunder shall be assignable by a Party without the prior written consent of the other Party, provided that either Party shall have the right, on notice to but without the other Party’s consent, to assign this Agreement and its rights and obligations contained herein, to an affiliate or to a third party who is not a competitor of the other Party in connection with a sale of all or substantially all of the assigning Party’s business or assets relating to this Agreement.
ollama_generated: This Agreement and its rights and obligations shall not be transferable by a Party without obtaining prior written consent from the other Party, except under the following conditions: either Party may, with notice to but without seeking the approval of the other, transfer this Agreement, together with its rights and duties as specified herein, to an affiliate or to a non-competing third party in the event of a sale involving all, or substantially all, of the transferring Party's business or assets pertaining to this Agreement.

original: It is the Parties desire and agreement that this Agreement and all Exhibits and associated documentation be drafted in English. Les Parties conviennent que la présente convention et tous les documents s’y rattachant, soient rédigés en anglais.
ollama_generated: The Parties mutually acknowledge and prefer that this Agreement, along with all its Exhibits and ancillary materials, will be prepared in the English language. However, should any translation errors arise during the drafting process, the original English text shall take precedence over any translated versions in case of discrepancies or ambiguities. Les Parties reconnaissent et s'accordent que la présente convention ainsi que tous les documents s'y rattachant seront rédigés en anglais. Toutefois, en cas d'erreurs de traduction lors du processus de rédaction, le texte original en anglais prévaudra sur toutes versions traduites dans l'éventualité de différences ou ambiguïtés.
